revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Review text carefully (esp. vac. in col. ii and v); revise metadata completely before finalization.

Submit - PSI XVII 1673 (first ed. DCLP)
Some notes: It is an astronomical table; so the columns have to be visualized side by side. In the number of lines, I indicates 41, considering the columns as part of a table, as in the ed. pr. Is it possible to align the numbers indicated as in the ed. pr.? In col. V is it possible to encode that the lines lost are ll. 7-21, as indicated in the ed.pr.
Under êÜä I need to insert a under dot, but I was not able to do it in: col. I 32, 40 col IV 22, 23 col. IV 32, 33, 34, 36, 38 (under the second êÜä of each line)
Col. III 40. I was not able to visualize [œõ] ŒºÃ£[Œ∑ Œª]Œ¥ Œª instead of [œõ] ŒºÃ£[Œ∑] [Œª]Œ¥ Œª
